image.altText: An image of a small carpark next to a Middle Arm boat ramp.

props.synopsis: The NT government has pushed back the timeline for its planned Middle Arm industrial hub, after federal government body Infrastructure Australia rejected its business case.

title.children: Controversial planned NT gas hub could face lengthy delays after business case sent back for more work

image.altText: A woman looks into the camera inside her home, with a framed photo of her son on the wall behind her.

props.synopsis: Samara Laverty wants to make sure what happened to her son Declan never happens to anyone else. But experts say ‘Declan’s Law’ could have unintended consequences which won’t make the community safer.

title.children: Declan Laverty was murdered by a man out on bail. Will tougher bail laws prevent another tragedy?

image.altText: A young Aboriginal man leans forward on the white rodeo arena railing and stares at the camera. He wears green prison garb.

props.synopsis: Police have arrested a senior employee with Australia's largest Indigenous legal aid service after she was allegedly caught harbouring a convicted killer in an Alice Springs hotel room.

title.children: Convicted killer fugitive allegedly caught in Alice Springs hotel room with senior NAAJA employee

image.altText: A man looks into the camera wearing a read and black sports club shirt.

props.synopsis: Tiwi Bombers are bouncing back from the brink, turning on electrifying performances in the NT Football League. A former Richmond Tiger is giving them a hand.

title.children: The Tiwi Bombers hit rock bottom in 2023. Now an AFL winner is helping turn it around

image.altText: A line of soldiers walking off a military plane parked on a runway, close to sunset.

props.synopsis: Experts say the next US administration could lead to a greater focus on defence in the Indo-Pacific region, and in turn, on northern Australia.

title.children: The next Trump administration could have a greater focus on defence in northern Australia

image.altText: an underwater wreath at a shipwreck

props.synopsis: Divers have visited the wreckage of a boat that sank during Cyclone Tracy 50 years ago to lay a wreath for those who died during the storm.

title.children: Divers lay wreath at Darwin shipwreck for lives lost at sea during Cyclone Tracy

image.altText: A man stands with a hand on his hip, wearing a uniform and medals, smiling.

props.synopsis: People across Australia gather to commemorate Remembrance Day and honour those who have died while serving in conflicts and peace-keeping operations.

title.children: Australians mark 106th Remembrance Day with services honouring the fallen

image.altText: Darwin Local Court

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old who allegedly caused “extremely serious injuries” using an edged weapon has been released on bail, with the judge noting a 12-month wait time for the matter to progress to trial.

title.children: First adult charged under NT government’s new post and boast laws faces court

image.altText: Lightning strike over the Brisbane River and south eastern Brisbane suburbs. Sunday November 8, 2024.

props.synopsis: A string of scorchers ended in a spectacular lightning display in south-east Queensland last night.

title.children: Severe storms likely in Queensland and New South Wales, bringing the threat of large hail and damaging winds

image.altText: A group of people standing next to, and looking at a house reduced to rubble by an airstrike.

props.synopsis: Israel's military says it is reviewing the strike, which it says was targeted at Hamas. The dawn strike is part of a renewed push by Israel to prevent Hamas from regrouping.

title.children: Eyewitnesses describe Israeli air strike as a 'massacre' after at least 24 people killed in Gaza

image.altText: Barbora Krejcikova looks down

props.synopsis: Tennis player Barbora Krejčíková calls for more professionalism in sports media after her appearance was criticised by Tennis Channel journalist Jon Wertheim.

title.children: 'This isn't the first time': Wimbledon winner calls for respect after journalist's comment about her looks

image.altText: A man in a grey black suit and glasses smiles for a photo

props.synopsis: Three executives from Perth-based mining company Resolute Mining detained in Africa have not been harmed and are "being looked after," according to WA Premier Roger Cook.

title.children: Mining executives held captive in Africa 'being looked after', WA premier says

image.altText: A young man with dark hair and a white dress shirt sits at a dinner table

props.synopsis: A Perth man accused of murdering his mother denies killing her, but admits lying to police and family members about fraudulent behaviour.

title.children: Man accused of murdering mother for life insurance payout admits lying to police and family, court hears

image.altText: Shayna Jack in one-piece swimwear, goggles and cap mid-leap out of a pool

props.synopsis: From vilified "drug cheat" to Olympic gold: The story behind Shayna Jack's extraordinary return to the winner's circle.

title.children: 'They just wanted to prove I was a cheat': Olympian Shayna Jack speaks out against anti-doping system

image.altText: cannabis, medicinal

props.synopsis: Veterans are being targeted by social media ads offering access to "free" medicinal cannabis, funded by the Department of Veterans Affairs. VeteranCann supplied medicinal cannabis to a man with a record of cannabis addiction, who ended up in "borderline psychosis".

title.children: 'I am addicted to THC': Medicinal cannabis company kept sending drug even after warnings

image.altText: Two boys in hoodies standing in a car park at night

props.synopsis: When a child isn’t safe with their family, they are placed into the care of the WA government. But some of these children and their foster parents are shining a spotlight on conditions they say are putting youth back in harm’s way.

title.children: 'WA would be horrified': Children in state care suffer physical, sexual abuse in homes

image.altText: A man with a beard wears a check shirt.

props.synopsis: Engineer Saul Griffith, architect of climate policy US Inflation Reduction Act, says Elon Musk and JD Vance can take inspiration from the Illawarra's Electrify 2515 project.

title.children: Australian who helped create landmark US climate policy 'optimistic' for climate action under Trump

image.altText: Richard Boyle speaks to supporters outside court.

props.synopsis: Richard Boyle tells the SA District Court he plans to testify in his own defence when he stands trial next year accused of 24 offences which carry a maximum prison sentence of 46 years.

title.children: Tax office whistleblower Richard Boyle tells court he will take the stand to testify in his own defence during trial

image.altText: Australian Army bugler outside the Sydney Opera House which has poppies projected on the sails.

props.synopsis: People across Australia gather to commemorate Remembrance Day and honour those who have died while serving in conflicts and peace-keeping operations.

title.children: Australians mark 106th Remembrance Day with services honouring the fallen

image.altText: A metal heart-shaped frame is packed with bouquets of flowers and notes.

props.synopsis: The anchors on the jumping castle at the centre of the 2021 Hillcrest tragedy failed because they did not comply with Australian standards, a court has heard.

title.children: Anchors for jumping castle at centre of Hillcrest tragedy not to Australian standard, engineer tells court

image.altText: the wind blows balck and yellow flags with yellow writing attached to fences of building sites with buildings behind

props.synopsis: Independent advisory firm KordaMentha has been asked by CFMEU administrator Mark Irving KC to probe the state branch.

title.children: Queensland CFMEU to be investigated for alleged links to bikie gangs and crime syndicates

image.altText: a driver behind the wheel at sunset

props.synopsis: An elderly woman loses an appeal to get her driver's licence back after failing two driving tests, including one where she amassed 182 penalty points — 160 more than a fail mark.

title.children: 97yo woman appeals licence suspension after amassing hundreds of penalty points in driving tests

image.altText: Kristian White wears a navy suit and tie as he enters the NSW Supreme Court in Sydney

props.synopsis: Senior Constable Kristian White has pleaded not guilty to the manslaughter of great-grandmother Clare Nowland, who was tasered at a Cooma aged care facility in 2023.

title.children: Police officer charged with manslaughter said 'bugger it' before tasering 95yo woman, court told

image.altText: A young mother sits on the floor holding a little boy, both smiling.

props.synopsis: After giving birth to Henry from her mother's donated womb, Kirsty Bryant began showing signs of organ rejection before she could have another child. Despite the change in plans, she feels "so lucky" to have her baby boy.

title.children: First Australian woman to give birth after uterus transplant undergoes hysterectomy

image.altText: An AFLW coach in shadow talks to his players during a break in play during a final.

props.synopsis: The knock on Hawthorn all season has been that they've been handed an easy AFLW draw. In Sunday's fiery final against the reigning premiers, the Hawks showed they can wrestle with the best.

title.children: 'That actually infuriates me': Hawks prove they are top-four contenders and not just handed an easy draw in fiery AFLW finals test

image.altText: Black and white photo of two men smiling standing behind nine small children, most of whom also smile.

props.synopsis: When school kids shouted that they saw a man with a gun, their teacher thought it was a prank. What followed was something the residents of a tiny town would never forget.

title.children: One Kombi van, 17 hostages and an outrageous ransom: The dramatic crime that took hold of a tiny Australian town

image.altText: Two firefighters pour water on a burning building in Ukraine at night.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky says the West needs to bolster its aid to the country, while the Kremlin says it saw "positive signals" from the election of Donald Trump.

title.children: Russia and Ukraine launch record-breaking drone strikes as Kremlin eyes Trump's next move

image.altText: Burma the elephant steps out of a large crate, as a zoo keeper stands either side of her

props.synopsis: Police escorts are not uncommon for dignitaries and heads of state — but a jumbo-sized new arrival in the form of an Asian elephant will be making its presence felt on some of Adelaide's main roads on Tuesday evening.

title.children: Jumbo-sized delivery to get peak-hour police escort to Monarto Zoo

image.altText: A composite image showing three writers and their book covers on a brown paper background

props.synopsis: The winner of the prestigious literary award — to be announced on November 12 — will take home $98,000 and receive a dramatic bump in book sales around the world.

title.children: 'I'd be gobsmacked if it won': Book experts dish on the Booker Prize shortlist

image.altText: A flag with the colours of the rainbow flying on a flag post.

props.synopsis: Proposed changes to the Racial and Religious Tolerance Act will balance individual rights, free speech and religious belief.

title.children: Proposed hate speech laws aimed at protecting the vulnerable spark mixed response

image.altText: A centenarian holds a photo of her young self while sitting her couch at home

props.synopsis: At 19, Margot McCormick quit working for her dad to join Australia's largest women's service branch — the organisation which paved the way for women to join the air force.

title.children: On Remembrance Day, 101-year-old Margot McCormick reflects on how she served Australia during WWII

image.altText: Two yellow bulldozers are parked beside white blades, one of which lies on the ground with a blurred image in the centre.

props.synopsis: Investigations have begun after a worker died in an incident at a wind farm construction project at Rokewood, west of Geelong in Victoria.

title.children: Man fatally crushed on wind farm construction site in Victoria

image.altText: Glenn Maxwell, Cooper Connolly and Josh Inglis speak

props.synopsis: Several players from Australia's World Cup-winning side were nowhere to be seen during the series decider against Pakistan. Former skipper Michael Clarke says it is symbolic of a larger issue in cricket.

title.children: 'We obviously don't care about losing': Michael Clarke criticises players being rested during series loss to Pakistan

image.altText: Rhesus macaques monkeys have been used for human research since the 1800s.

props.synopsis: Twenty-four monkeys were captured on Sunday, a day after another of the 43 escaped monkeys was recovered.

title.children: How a South Carolina lab plans to capture 18 on-the-run monkeys

image.altText: A closeup of two panting labradoodles with golden matted fur with round pink tongues hanging out.

props.synopsis: With Tasmania's government pledging it's "committed to improving animal welfare" in abattoirs, experts say all animal cruelty laws must be toughened or another "puppy farm" outrage will occur.

title.children: Another labradoodles outrage will happen without overhaul of cruelty laws, experts warn
